title: Iranian Revolution
description: The Iranian Revolution overthrows the Pahlavi monarchy and establishes an Islamic republic.

title: Mount St. Helens Eruption
description: The eruption of Mount St. Helens in Washington, USA, causes widespread destruction.

title: Assassination of John Lennon
description: John Lennon, former Beatle, is assassinated outside his New York City apartment.

title: Falklands War
description: A war between the United Kingdom and Argentina over the disputed Falkland Islands.

title: Beirut Barracks Bombing
description: A terrorist bombing kills 241 American servicemen in Lebanon.

title: Bhopal Gas Tragedy
description: A gas leak from a Union Carbide plant in India kills thousands of people.

title: Live Aid Concert
description: A global benefit concert to raise funds for Ethiopian famine relief.

title: Chernobyl Nuclear Disaster
description: A nuclear disaster in Chernobyl, Ukraine, leads to the release of radioactive material.

title: Black Monday
description: The global stock markets crash, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average losing 22%.

title: Pan Am Flight 103 Bombing
description: A terrorist bombing of a Pan Am flight over Lockerbie, Scotland, kills 270 people.

title: Fall of Berlin Wall
description: The Berlin Wall falls, symbolizing the end of the Cold War and the reunification of Germany.

title: Nelson Mandela Released
description: Nelson Mandela is released from prison, marking the beginning of the end of apartheid in South Africa.

title: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
description: The Soviet Union dissolves into 15 independent republics, marking the end of the Cold War.

title: Rodney King Riots
description: Riots erupt in Los Angeles after the acquittal of police officers involved in the beating of Rodney King.

title: World Trade Center Bombing
description: A bombing at the World Trade Center in New York City kills six people and injures over a thousand.

title: Rwandan Genocide
description: A genocide in Rwanda leads to the deaths of an estimated 800,000 people.

title: Oklahoma City Bombing
description: A truck bomb kills 168 people in Oklahoma City, the deadliest domestic terrorist attack in U.S. history.

title: Tupac Shakur Murder
description: Rap artist Tupac Shakur is fatally shot in a drive-by shooting in Las Vegas.

title: Princess Diana Dies in Car Crash
description: Princess Diana dies in a car crash in Paris, sparking global mourning.

title: Google Founded
description: Google is founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin, revolutionizing internet search.

title: Columbine High School Shooting
description: A school shooting at Columbine High School in Colorado leaves 15 people dead.

title: Y2K Bug
description: The Y2K bug raised concerns about computer systems failing at the turn of the millennium.

title: 9/11 Attacks
description: Terrorist attacks on the World Trade Center in New York City.

title: Euro Introduced
description: The Euro becomes the official currency of 12 European Union countries.

title: Iraq War Begins
description: The United States and allies invade Iraq, beginning the Iraq War.

title: Indian Ocean Tsunami
description: A massive earthquake and tsunami strike countries around the Indian Ocean, killing over 230,000 people.

title: Hurricane Katrina
description: Hurricane Katrina devastates New Orleans, causing widespread flooding and damage.

title: Twitter Launched
description: Twitter is launched, changing the landscape of social media.

title: Global Financial Crisis
description: A global financial crisis begins, triggered by the collapse of Lehman Brothers.

title: Obama Elected President
description: Barack Obama is elected as the first African-American president of the United States.

title: H1N1 Pandemic
description: The H1N1 swine flu pandemic affects millions worldwide.

title: Haiti Earthquake
description: A devastating earthquake strikes Haiti, killing over 230,000 people.

title: Osama Bin Laden Killed
description: U.S. Navy SEALs kill Osama bin Laden, the mastermind behind the 9/11 attacks.

title: Sandy Hook Elementary Shooting
description: A mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Connecticut kills 26 people.

title: Boston Marathon Bombing
description: A bombing at the Boston Marathon kills three and injures hundreds.

title: Rise of ISIS
description: ISIS gains power in Iraq and Syria, leading to widespread violence.

title: Paris Climate Agreement
description: Countries around the world sign the Paris Climate Agreement to combat climate change.

title: Brexit Vote
description: The United Kingdom votes to leave the European Union, known as Brexit.

title: Me Too Movement
description: The Me Too movement spreads, highlighting issues of sexual harassment and assault.

title: Global Youth Climate Strikes
description: Young people around the world strike for action on climate change, inspired by Greta Thunberg.

title: Notre-Dame Cathedral Fire
description: A fire severely damages the Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris, France.

title: COVID-19 Pandemic
description: The COVID-19 pandemic spreads worldwide, leading to lockdowns and millions of deaths.

title: US Capitol Riot
description: Supporters of Donald Trump storm the U.S. Capitol in an attempt to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Russia Invades Ukraine
description: Russia invades Ukraine, leading to a large-scale conflict in Eastern Europe.

title: Global Climate Crisis
description: The world faces increasingly extreme weather events due to climate change.

title: Advancements in AI
description: AI technology continues to revolutionize industries, from healthcare to automation.
